Deprecated Commands

These commands will still work, but should be generally avoided for better efficiency and the fact they might get completely removed in the future. You can tick the Auto Replace 'Compare' to 'Statement' checkbox at the top of your deck to automatically replace your deprecated commands with the new statement commands whenever you go edit your buttons (you will be able to still review the changes).

Math: Change Variable (old)

Create or change a variable. If you try to execute math (such as +=) on a variable that was not created, it will be set to 0.

Name Type Description
Variable String Name of the variable. Accepts anything including spaces and numbers.
Math Dropdown menu Type of math to execute on the variable
Value Real/String Number/String to process. Must be a direct value, not a variable name. In this case use Math: Variable to Variable command.

Math: Variable to Variable

Same as Math: Change Variable command, but processes two different variables rather than variable + direct value.

Name Type Description
Variable String Name of the variable. Accepts anything including spaces and numbers.
Math Dropdown menu Type of math to execute on the variables.
Variable String Name of the variable to process. Must be already created.

Compare: Skip if

Prevents the following commands from happening if the math is true.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.
You can use nested Compare: Skip if commands to check for multiple conditions or to make the execution more effective.
Make sure the delay for Compare: Skip if command is always equal or smaller than the delay for the following commands you want to include in your skip if steps. Otherwise the commands will get executed regardless of the math result.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable name made from Math: Change Variable command
Math Dropdown menu Name of the string to parse. Use /$variable$/ if you used File: Load String command.
Value String/Real Name of the string to parse. Use /$variable$/ if you used File: Load String command.
Step Int Number of commands to skip if the result is true.

Compare: End if

Prevents ALL commands from happening (and ends them prematurely) if the math is true. Does not affect other buttons.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.
You can use this command to temporarily disable a button.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable name made from Math: Change Variable command
Math Dropdown menu Math to execute and check if it's true or false.
Value String/Real Value to compare to the variable value.

Compare: Redo if

Reactivates the following commands for as long as the math is true. Once it reactivates the commands, delay does not matter, as it will make the commands happen on a frame per second basis.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.
This is a very useful command to:

  • Continuously check whether a value has changed and immediately react to it. For example, you can make a button change its color based on which scene you're currently on.

  • Make a simple timer using Variable: Transition command.

  • Make a smooth filter transition from value A to value B. For example, you can make a smooth crop animation.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable made from Math: Change Variable command
Math Dropdown menu Math to execute and check if it's true or false.
Value String/Real Value to compare to the variable value.
Step Int Number of commands to redo if the result is true.
Self boolean Whether you want to include the command itself in the loop.
If set to false, it will repeat only once.

Compare: Redo Previous if

Same as Compare: Redo if, but reactivates the previous commands instead.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable made from Math: Change Variable command.
Math Dropdown menu Math to execute and check if it's true or false.
Value String/Real Second variable to compare to the first one.
Step Int Number of commands to redo if the result is true.
Self boolean Whether you want to include the command itself in the loop.
If set to false, it will repeat only once.

Compare Variable: Skip if

Same as Compare: Skip if command, except you can compare two different variables instead of one variable and one value.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable made from Math: Change Variable command.
Math Dropdown menu Math to execute and check if it's true or false.
Variable String Second variable to compare to the first one.
Step Int Number of commands to skip if the result is true.

Compare Variable: End if

Same as Compare: End if command, except you can compare two different variables instead of one variable and one value.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable made from Math: Change Variable command.
Math Dropdown menu Math to execute and check if it's true or false.
Variable String Second variable to compare to the first one.

Compare Variable: Redo if

Same as Compare: Redo if command, except you can compare two different variables instead of one variable and one value.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable made from Math: Change Variable command
Math Dropdown menu Math to execute and check if it's true or false.
Variable String Second variable to compare to the first one.
Step Int Number of commands to redo if the result is true.
Self boolean Whether you want to include the command itself in the loop.
If set to false, it will repeat only once.

Compare Variable: Redo Previous if

Same as Compare: Redo previous if command, except you can compare two different variables instead of one variable and one value.
Remember to always compare the same types of values - either strings or numbers.

Name Type Description
Variable String Variable made from Math: Change Variable command
Math Dropdown menu Math to execute and check if it's true or false.
Variable String Second variable to compare to the first one.
Step Int Number of commands to redo if the result is true.
Self boolean Whether you want to include the command itself in the loop.
If set to false, it will repeat only once.

Repeat Previous

Repeats the previous commands in the list. Unlike Compare: Redo command, this command will repeat everything instantly.
For example, this is useful for instantly retrieving multiple values from File: Load Value/String or from Stack: Pull command.
If you include Repeat in your Compare: Redo steps, it will reset the repeat count to 0 and therefore it might create an infinite loop. Same goes for repeat, repeating other repeats.

Name Type Description
Repeat amount Int How many times the steps should be repeated
Repeat Step Int Number of steps to repeat

Stack: Add (old)

Adds a value to a given stack. Will create one if it doesn't exist yet.

Name Type Description
Stack Name String A stack name. Can be anything.
Position Real Position to add the value to. Can be top for the top of the stack or 0 (bottom of the stack).
Any number higher than the stack size will be regarded as the top.
Value Real/String Value to save in the stack. Can be either a number or a string.
Real boolean Specify if you want to save a real value (number) or a string. True=real or False=string.

Stack: Replace (old)

Replaces a value inside a stack, deleting the previous one and replacing it by the new one.

Name Type Description
Stack Name String A stack name you want to work with.
Position number Position of the value to be replaced. Either a number (first position=0) or top=top of the stack and bottom=bottom of the stack.
Value String/Real The new value to save.
Real String Specify if you want to save a real value (number) or a string. True=real or False=string.
